article.headline: Domino's Pizza shares rise after earnings blow past expectations
article.body: Domino's Pizza Inc. DPZ, -2.50% shares rose 0.3% in Thursday premarket trading after the pizza delivery chain reported second-quarter earnings and revenue that far exceeded expectations. Net income totaled $118.7 million, or $2.99 per share, up from $92.4 million, or $2.19 per share, last year. Total revenue was $920.0 million, up from $811.6 million last year. The FactSet consensus was for EPS of $2.24 and revenue of $915.0 million. U.S. same-store sales grew 16.1%, and international same-store sales rose 1.3%. The FactSet consensus was for domestic growth of 11.9% and a global rise of 0.7%. As of June 14, Domino's had $248 million in cash and equivalents and $4.17 billion in total debt. The company borrowed $158 million under its variable funding notes during the quarter "as a precautionary measure." Domino's stock has rallied nearly 41% for the year to date while the S&P 500 index SPX, +0.87% has slipped 0.1% for the period.
